#Text=Wikinews Shorts : April 2 , 2007
#Text=A compilation of brief news reports for Monday , April 2 , 2007 .
#Text=Argentinians mark 25th anniversary of Guerra de las Malvinas
#Text=Today marks the 25th anniversary of Argentina 's invasion of the Falkland Islands , a British overseas territory .
#Text=The public holiday will be marked by memorial services to remember the dead , but it is also an opportunity to reiterate the country 's claim to sovereignty of the Falkland Islands .
#Text=Sources
#Text=" Argentina marks Falkland invasion " — BBC News Online , April 2 , 2007

column1: #Text=The US Supreme Court will not rule on habeas corpus for detainees
#Text=The US Supreme Court majority opinion was that " the will of Congress " should prevail on the provision of the Military Commissions Act of 2006 that was being challenged .
#Text=The 6 to 3 decision means that detainees at Guantánamo will not be able file habeas corpus challenges in US courts .
#Text=Sources
#Text=" Top court rejects Guantanamo test " — BBC News Online , April 2 , 2007

column1: #Text=Greg Stohr .
#Text=" Guantanamo Bay Inmate Appeals Rejected by High Court " — Bloomberg L.P. , April 2 , 2007
#Text=Russian scientist : Iran could create nuclear weapons

#Text=In an interview with Reuters , Russia 's Secretary of the Public Chamber , President of the Kurchatov Institute , and a leading nuclear scientist , Yevgeny Velikhov said : " From a scientific point of view of course they could create nuclear weapons , " and pointed to how the United States had underestimated the amount of time it would take the Soviet Union .
#Text=" I consider biological , chemical and nuclear arms should be forbidden and that the holding and development of nuclear weapons should be considered a crime against humanity , " he said .
#Text=Sources
#Text=Guy Faulconbridge .
#Text=" Russian expert says Iran can make nuclear weapons " — Reuters , April 2 , 2007
#Text=Nelly Furtado leads 2007 Juno Award winners

#Text=Canada 's major music awards weekend ended Sunday night with pop singer Nelly Furtado winning Juno Awards in five categories including best artist , best single for her song Promiscuous , and best album for her 2006 release Loose .
#Text=Furtado was also host of last night 's televised ceremonies from Saskatoon , the first time the province of Saskatchewan has hosted the Junos .
#Text=The Juno Awards began in 1970 as the Gold Leaf Awards and honour Canadian music achievements .
#Text=Other winners included Dixie Chicks , Billy Talent , Tomi Swick , Mobile , and Gordie Sampson .
#Text=Sources
#Text=" 2007 Juno Award winners " — Canadian Academy of Recording Arts and Sciences , April 1 , 2007
#Text=" Sexy but goofy , Furtado sweeps Juno Awards " — Canadian Broadcasting Corporation , April 1 , 2007
#Text=External links
#Text=Juno Awards official site
#Text=Yushchenko calls early elections in Ukraine
#Text=President Viktor Yushchenko dissolved Ukraine 's parliament and called early elections Monday .
#Text=" My actions are dictated by the strict necessity to save the state 's sovereignty and territorial integrity , " he said in a televised address .
#Text=However , members of the parliament said it would continue to function as-is , and would refuse to fund the election .
#Text=Ukraine has been in a political turmoil as the president and his rival Prime Minister Viktor Yanukovych position for power .
#Text=According to BBC News reports , the official election is set for May 27 .
#Text=Sources
#Text=" Ukraine leader calls early poll " — BBC News Online , April 2 , 2007
#Text=" Ukraine president calls early vote ; Parliament turns cheek " — CNN International , April 2 , 2007
